intro: Airopsis pallida, commonly known as the pale airopsis, is a species of green alga belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is typically found in marine environments, growing on rocky substrates in shallow coastal waters. The plant has a thallus that is flat and ribbon-like, with a smooth, pale green color. It reproduces through both sexual and asexual means, producing gametes and spores. Airopsis pallida plays a role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
